content.description: Sit start matched on the arete. From there, work up the arete using the good edges, use a great left hand sidepull half way up, gain the lip, and mantel on top.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. There is large rock that takes up most of the landing's left side.
content.location: It climbs the northwest arete of Muy Rock.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand sidepull and a right hand on the arete with a decent thumb-catch. From there, reach a left hand incut edge, follow to a right hand sloper with another thumb-catch (the texture is brilliant on this hold!), then reach another left hand incut edge, bring the feet along, cross over the top with a right hand to a jug, match on it, then traverse left along the lip, and then finish up the remaining slab using the bumps and generous slot feature.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing has a pair of rocks that could make for a bad fall if they're not padded.
content.location: It climbs the south/southwest face of Muy. Starts just left of Bebop.

content.description:
Bebop climbs a short, overhanging arete on perfect stone over an equally ideal landing.

Stand start with a left hand crimp and a right hand compressing the arete. From there, work a high left heel, move the right hand up high on the arete, gain the sloping false lip, and mantel on top.

A slightly awkward sit start can be added as well. It adds a handful of moves but not sure it does anything to the difficulty or quality though.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is flat and clear though.
content.location: It climbs the south facing nose of Muy Rock.
